text: Péter Veres (born 22 February 1979) is a Hungarian volleyball player, a member of Hungary men's national volleyball team in 2001–2008 and Italian club LPR Piacenza, 1998 Hungarian Champion, double Spanish Champion (2004, 2005). ==Career== ===Clubs=== Peter won the Best Receiver award for the 2010–11 CEV Champions League Final Four, also winning the bronze medal with VC Dynamo Moscow.LM siatkarzy: Jastrzębski Węgiel przegrał z Dynamem Moskwa w meczu o trzecie miejsce - eurosport.onet.pl - 27-03-2011 In season 2013/2014 played for Asseco Resovia Rzeszów.Peter Veres w Asseco Resovii - plusliga.pl - 26-05-2013 He left club from Poland after winning silver medal of Polish Championship 2014.Peter Veres odchodzi z Asseco Resovii - plusliga.pl - 29-04-2014 ==Sporting achievements== ===Clubs=== ====CEV Champions League==== * 16px 2010/2011 - with VC Dynamo Moscow ====CEV Cup==== * 16px 2011/2012 - with VC Dynamo Moscow ====National championships==== * 1997/1998 16px Hungarian Championship, with Nyíregyháza * 2003/2004 16px Spanish Championship, with Unicaja Almería * 2004/2005 16px Spanish Championship, with Unicaja Almería * 2010/2011 16px Russian Championship, with VC Dynamo Moscow * 2011/2012 16px Russian Championship, with VC Dynamo Moscow * 2013/2014 16px Polish SuperCup2013, with Asseco Resovia Rzeszów * 2013/2014 16px Polish Championship, with Asseco Resovia Rzeszów ===Individually=== * 2011 CEV Champions League -
